page.description: Deals with issues of flexibility of the objects in SQL::DatabaseSnapshot.

section.description: Because of the flexibility of the objects in SQL::DatabaseSnapshot, there are likely to be several ways to solve any problem. In this case we will use the SQL::Schema object to get the definitions of all of the tables and then remove one table from the schema object. We will then snapshot the remaining tables using the schema as a reference.

section.example: dim cn as SQL::Connection dim sn as SQL::DatabaseSnapshot dim sc as SQL::Schema cn.open("::Named::MyDatabase") 'Open the source database cn.GetSchema(sc) 'Load the schema from the source database sc.DeleteTable(sc.TableNumber("MeetingNote")) 'Remove one of the tables from the schema sn.load(cn, sc) 'Take a snapshot of schema tables file.from_string("<MyFile>", sn.XML) 'Save the snapshot as XML
